*There was a deep aching pain as the merge procedure begin, something that 
she hadn�t expected but her systems were too far gone to care.
If only she knew of the thought that was going through Prowls head at that 
time, if only she knew.
But Iron Raptors body just hung there, limp and failing to move. Her spark 
going through what process in order to cure this plaguing beast mode, her 
eyes even finally closing and her thoughts actually beginning to dim.
Though, for some reason her thoughts, mind; all of that suddenly knowing 
before it went black, that as soon as she closed her eyes�there was a fairly 
good chance that she would never open them again.
And with that, everything just stopped�.

Iris was watching everything with a bit more doubt then she knew that she 
should feel, remembering how Prowls very form almost seemed to change once 
she had mentioned the name Dinobot for the first time.
She somehow knew that this exploratory procedure would NOT go off without a 
hitch.
But what she saw next was something that she hadn�t expected to see, nothing 
like she had ever seen before.
At least not up close.
Watching in wonder and horror, Iris watched both sparks detonate and create 
a whole shock wave which was heading right for her.*

IRIS: � He�s failed!�

* And that was all she could get out before the shock wave reached her, 
cracking the monitor screen further before blacking out her systems.
Whatever happened after that, she did not know.*

________________________________________________________AFTER:

* The early morning sun beat down upon a vast field, it very difficult to 
tell that only a matter of mega-cycles ago�everything had been leveled.
Light winds blowing in from the south to creating a waving effect over the 
long grasses of the plain, everything seeming as if nothing at all had ever 
happened.

Completely unaware of Prowls awakening, she lay on her side at a slant 
several feet away. Hidden in the long grass, which made up the field with 
which all had happened.
Not knowing that only mega-cycles ago she had been dead, her spark 
evaporated in the detonation.
	She lay on her side, unconscious and unharmed, all seeming fine despite the 
earlier explosion.
But now, now everything seemed to be different, so very different. Not even 
her form was the same.

Her spark fueled by the very existence of Prowl, even her beast mode had 
changed.
However, now she lay among the tall and waving grasses in robot mode, 
changed from Prowls deal with the Matrix�and not even knowing about it..
And more different then she could ever hope to imagine!


The early morning sun shone down upon waves of snow-white metallic hair as 
it fell over the newly shaped curves of her body. Extending from the crown 
of her head to the back of her bare knees, blue skin appearing through gaps 
in the flowing white sheet of hair.
Blue and shapely legs extended out from under her hair, disappearing into 
the long grass around her.
With her face hidden in the crook of one arm, her other stretched out away 
from her and just as hidden as her legs in the long grasses. White nails 
tipping her unseen hands as well as on the tips of her toes.
But even though her body seemed to resemble that of a blue skinned, bare, 
whit haired human woman, every piece of it was some sort of refined metal 
alloy.
But all the time Iron Raptor had no idea that just as her body had changed, 
so now was her life. *
